title: [BUG] If SKCanvasView is inside CollectionView, PaintSurface is not called upon reusing CollectionView DataTemplate
body:
**Description**

Having SKCanvasView in CollectionView in Xamarin.Forms causing not all items are displayed properly: when they are reused, InvalidateSurface() is not being called.

It happens only on iOS (tested on 13.4), on Android, it seems to work ok.
Tested on XF 4.5.0.617 and 4.5.0.530- both same
SkiaSharp.Views.Forms 1.68.1.1

**Code**

Open attached project, and run on iOS
[CollectionViewBug.zip](https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/files/4462946/CollectionViewBug.zip)

If you see the debug output log, you could also see that on iOS, after you scroll out the first page, it does not call SKCanvasViewIconListItem_PaintSurface to paint the new items scrolled into the view.
On Android, you could see that SKCanvasViewIconListItem_PaintSurface is called for every item as you scroll.

**Expected Behavior**

To display all items in CollectionView properly by calling SKCanvasViewIconListItem_PaintSurface  even on the reused items.

**Basic Information**

- Version with issue:  1.68.1.1
- IDE:  Visual Studio 16.5.3
- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - iOS:  13.4

**Screenshots**

Android: OK, numbers are 1..150

![android](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9251057/79015206-9f72b280-7b6c-11ea-9195-bb982d06f874.png)

---------------------

iOS: NOT OK, after scrolling out first page and reaching number 40th, listitems are being reused, PaintSurface() is not called on them - so they display "old" drawings.

![ios](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9251057/79015264-baddbd80-7b6c-11ea-9ab4-d2e74497cdb1.png)
